title: Meet our Team
text:
Meet the First CPP SACNAS Chapter E-board!

President and Co-Founder
Jordyn Scott
Major: Environmental Biology
Minor: Chemistry








I am excited to offer a space where both culture and academic aspirations can be celebrated amongst CPP STEM students! As someone who has not felt seen and heard in STEM classes and discussions, I hope to help others build the belief that they can succeed in their field and affirm that they belong there. With community-based workshops, socials, and volunteering opportunities, I want other students to find dependable support and resources within CPP SACNAS that will prepare them for the next step in their vocational journey. And above all, I am grateful to be a part of an amazing team working to uplift our peers and perpetuate this mission to diversify the STEM field!




Vice President
Matthew Luna (he/him)
Major: Physics
Minor: Mathematics
For me I want to help in building up a SACNAS community in any way that I can. Through the E-board, my goal is to provide an inclusive community and a valuable resource for SACNAS students to achieve their goals in STEM.


Treasurer and Co-Founder
Ximena Corona (she/her)
Biology Graduate Student (Biomedical/Immunology)
As someone who cannot vote, and who’s voice is often overlooked, I find myself feeling helpless when trying to bring about change. Establishing a SACNAS chapter and serving on the E-board is a way for me to contribute to my community and help students who like me, have big dreams and goals, but don’t know what steps they need to take to get there. I want to help students even the playing ground for themselves, and the only way to do so is with the proper tools!


Co-Director of Event Programming
Jasmyne Reyes-Estrada (she/her)
Major: Chemistry
Minor: Mathematics
Being on the E-Board means that I get to uplift Chicano and Native American voices and build a diverse community on campus where students feel supported and encouraged to pursue their journey in science!


Co-Director of Event Programming
Vanessa Galindo (she/her)
Major: Biology (Zoology Emphasis)
What being on the SACNAS E-Board means to me is that I can help build a community on campus of people who are often underrepresented in the field of STEM and to help them show the world que si se puede.


Director of Public Relations
Lisset Hernandez (she/they)
Major: Biology (Zoology Emphasis)


Secretary
Christian Suarez (he/him)
Major: Biology
Being a promoter of equity and inclusion for STEM, a field where diversity is a necessity


Science Council Representative
Esbai Rabadan (she/her)
Major: Biology
I am extremely grateful for this opportunity to help lead this new chapter at Cal Poly Pomona! As a first-generation college student with Mexican immigrant parents, I have witnessed firsthand the lack of help when it comes to finding support and information about STEM in my community. With the goal of achieving diversity in this field, I want to serve as support to help bridge the gap of access to resources and opportunities for underrepresented Chicano, Hispanic, and Native American students in STEM. I hope to contribute to creating a future where diversity is not just celebrated but is an integral part of the STEM workforce. I look forward to serving as the Science Council Representative for SACNAS!

SACNAS Travel Scholarship Workshop Pt 1 & 2
To ensure were equipped with the appropriate resources and information to apply for the NDISTEM Conference Travel Scholarship, we held a Personal Statement Workshop and a Resume Workshop with a presentation led by a faculty mentor then peer/mentor review and discussion following.

DEIA Flash Talk x Pot Painting Social

Discussion led by Dr. Mora-Garcia of CPP Chemistry Department
With this event we wanted to create space that facilitated conversation about students’ experience pursuing STEM. Collaboarting with B.A.T.S., Giology Graduate Student Association, Society of Physics Students, Women and Gender Minorities in Physics, Compost Club, and Zoology Club, everyone was able to find support in others’ who have experienced similar barriers/stigma and empowerment in knowing they are able to overcome these obstacles.
While discussing amongst each other, we painted mini plant pots, and planted native wildflower seeds in them to take home!

title: SACNAS
text:
Under the umbrella of the national organization, Society for the Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans in Science (SACNAS), we are a newly established Cal Poly Pomona Chapter. We became an official CPP club January 2025. Since, we have been able to perpetuate our mission of creating a cohesive STEM community where URMs of all disciplines feel welcomed, safe, and empowered to continue their STEM journey.
This is just the beginning for this chapter, and we are excited to continue building this unique community and spread our impact both on and off-campus in the coming years!
If you are interested in following our upcoming events, fundraisers, and more please follow our Instagram below. For any further inquiries, please reach out to sacnascpp@gmail.com

title: Society for the Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans in Science
text:
The Cal Poly Pomona SACNAS Chapter stands to uplift underrepresented minority groups pursuing STEM fields.
Through professional development workshops, off-campus volunteer and community engagement opportunities, DEIA flash talks, creative and uplifting socials, and collaborations with other on-campus clubs and organizations, we hope to create a space where everyone can…..

“Bring your whole self to STEM”
